item.title: CVE-2018-10936|2024-08-05T07:54:36.516Z -- %5Bunknown%5D -- postgresql
item.description: A weakness was found in postgresql-jdbc before version 42.2.5. It was possible to provide an SSL Factory and not check the host name if a host name verifier was not provided to the driver. This could lead to a condition where a man-in-the-middle attacker could masquerade as a trusted server by providing a certificate for the wrong host, as long as it was signed by a trusted CA.
